comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: Her father was a founder of what is now the notable Jones,Day law firm (no relation). www.fundinguniverse.com/company-histories/Jones-Day-Reavi...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Mildred Rice, who had been a debutante herself in 1911, was among the 35 guests who filled five tables at Sherry's (a famous New York City restaurant) for the debutante luncheon of Miss Dorothy Legg Howard, on January 5, 1914. New York Times story, January 6, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F00E14FC3C5412...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Taken at the same spot (maybe at the same event, but not that debutante luncheon -- at least, these two aren't on the guest list)
